title: @Phreak @Meddler Any reason why Aatrox's Blood Price does not proc lifesteal?
body:
I've always wondered why this was a special case in terms of bonus damage on-hit auto attacks. I'm not a mathematician, so I'm curious to know how "OP" it would be in terms of early or late game. Would it make it so people consider not using Blood Thirst assuming you do get enough life steal therefore making it a useless skill?

Edit: Wrote enhanced auto instead of on-hit.
Edit 2: For those curious there are many abilities with on-hit that proc lifesteal.

replies.body: Pretty much no spells apply life steal. The only ones that do are quite special: Parrrley and Mystic Shot are fairly obvious examples of this. Otherwise, you should never consider skill damage to apply lifesteal. The ones that do are auto-attack replacements.

But Aatrox W is not a Spell like Parrley or Mystic shot it is an Auto Attack Modifier like Siphoning Strike, Power Fist, Crippling Strike, Deceicive Strike, Triforce and many others. All of whom apply lifesteal, with the exception of Blood Price.

> [{quoted}](name=Phreak,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oWR4g5A3,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-09-21T06:53:20.595+0000)
>
> Pretty much no spells apply life steal. The only ones that do are quite special: Parrrley and Mystic Shot are fairly obvious examples of this. Otherwise, you should never consider skill damage to apply lifesteal. The ones that do are auto-attack replacements.

I'm not sure if you know which spell are we talking about, Blood price is the Aatrox  W which is basically a 3hit passive similar to Vayne or Vi's  but which has a counter on Aatrox AA's instead of counting on an opponent, It IS an auto attack and NOT a skill

> [{quoted}](name=J Eevo,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oWR4g5A3,comment-id=00010008,timestamp=2015-09-21T20:20:22.709+0000)
>
> I'm not sure if you know which spell are we talking about, Blood price is the Aatrox  W which is basically a 3hit passive similar to Vayne or Vi's  but which has a counter on Aatrox AA's instead of counting on an opponent, It IS an auto attack and NOT a skill

The damage is just applied as a bonus on the auto.
Draven's q does proc Lifesteal, it's an auto attack enhancement, not sure I would call it replacement.

Sure but, his W doesn't feel like a spell, it just feels like his unique autos. This would be a good buff for him and is more intuitive, when I started playing the game I thought it did because it just made sense that it would.
But Aatrox's W DOES replace his auto-attack :(
Ah ok, Thanks for the clarification.
Jax R passive applies spell vamp and spell effects on every third hit (though it is a special case)
That's magic damage not physical damage for lifesteal.

And also, it would be soo troll. Aatrox already gets bonus dmg from blood price and a ton of atk spd from his passive and ult. He doesn't need expenential sustain when he opts for dmg, that doesn't make any sense and makes blood thirst completely lackluster mid to late game.

 Not to mention he has good base and scaling AD and AS.
It is an on hit effect, not an enhanced auto attack. On hit effects do not proc life steal normally.

> [{quoted}](name=Xuldin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oWR4g5A3,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-09-21T06:16:53.535+0000)
>
> It is an on hit effect, not an enhanced auto attack. On hit effects do not proc life steal normally.

Most physical damage on-hits *do* proc lifesteal though.

Ooops. I wrote enhanced auto. According to the spell description it is an on-hit effect every third auto. "Aatrox applies a bonus effect on every third basic attack". It's considered an on-hit similar to Noxian Diplomacy, Parley, etc. 
Edit: If that's the case it should proc lifesteal.
Spellvamp works with it if that makes you feel better.

Wait it does? he he hehehe ha ha ha.

Ragegunblade Aatrox may not be so bad an idea after all.
Rageblade, Steraks, Maw, Zhonya, blade, GA.  Enjoy not being able to die lmao
